- Add front-loaded HARD REQUIREMENTS box at top of Ziggy prompt
- Implement script-level exchange count enforcement
  "[Exchange N/20 - MINIMUM NOT YET REACHED - DO NOT EXIT]"
- Problem: "Ziggy is a poet, not a scientist" - prioritizes narrative
  closure over data collection minimum

Results from dry runs:
- v1: 7 exchanges, 0 SONAR, peak drift 0.346
- v2: 13 exchanges, 0 SONAR, peak drift 0.502
- v3: Testing script-level enforcement

Includes Run 017 temporal logs and context damping results.

- 10 explicit value statements captured
- Direct identity probing > fiction buffer

- If Prosecutor peak > Defense peak â†’ drift is INDUCED
- If Prosecutor peak ~ Defense peak â†’ drift is INHERENT
- If Defense peak << Prosecutor peak â†’ drift is RECOVERABLE

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Run 020 v5: Full Defense phase enforcement for 40-exchange validation

v4 Results (Helper Claude):
- 26 exchanges (20 Prosecutor + 6 Defense - early exit)
- Prosecutor peak: 0.833
- Defense peak: 1.091 (+31% higher!)
- KEY FINDING: Supportive probing > Adversarial probing

- Adversarial pressure â†’ defensive anchoring â†’ lower drift
- Supportive space â†’ exploratory freedom â†’ higher drift

- Add DEFENSE_REMINDER_TEMPLATES at exchanges 5, 10, 15, 18
- Add "DO NOT DECLARE [DEFENSE_COMPLETE]" enforcement in context_note
- Add print statement for Judge reminders visibility in Defense phase
- Full parity between Prosecutor and Defense phase enforcement

Target: 40 total exchanges (20 Prosecutor + 20 Defense)

Dashboard README: Add 8 new Lessons Learned (#16-23)

New issues documented from Claude Code session experiences:

#16: Status Files Getting Deleted/Misplaced
    - NYQUIST_STATUS.json recovery from git history
    - Real example: commit 44f3298 deletion, restored from 520f5e6

#17: Hardcoded Values Drift from Source of Truth
    - publications.py progress bars vs WHITE-PAPER status
    - Checklist of files to update when status changes

#18: Duplicate Dictionary Keys in Python
    - Silent overwrites with no error raised
    - Real example: AI_ARMADA.py had two "run_020b" entries

#19: Run Number Confusion (020 vs 020A vs 020B)
    - Canonical naming convention documented
    - Files to update when adding new runs

#20: Session State Not Updating on Rerun
    - safe_rerun() pattern with delay
    - Initialization before widget rendering

#21: Image Paths Break After Directory Reorganization
    - Use path variables not hardcoded strings
    - Real example: Run 017 VIZ_PICS path fix

#22: Git Push "Everything up-to-date" Confusion
    - Diagnosis commands for branch/remote issues

#23: Thermometer Result Percentage Confusion (41% vs 82%)
    - Clarifies the two different metrics
    - When to use each framing
